channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: EchoStar’s stock is surging. Why AT&T just struck a $23 billion spectrum deal with the company.
item.description: AT&T will look to enhance its wireless and home-internet offerings with spectrum from EchoStar.

item.title: Customers are rushing to coffee shops like Starbucks and Dunkin’ thanks to the pumpkin-spice latte ‘halo effect’
item.description: Starbucks sees foot traffic spike 24% thanks to PSLs. “It’s great just to get people in the door,” analysts say.

item.title: Tommy Hilfiger parent says it still expects 2025 to be a comeback year, even as tariffs upend clothing industry

item.title: Cracker Barrel dumps new logo after backlash, and its stock rallies

item.title: My aunt barely spends any money. Will we receive the contents of her safe-deposit box when she dies?
item.description: “I am asking for my mom, who is on a fixed income. It would be a nice boon.”

item.title: How procedural memory can cut the cost and complexity of AI agents
item.description: Memp takes inspiration from human cognition to give LLM agents "procedural memory" that can adapt to new tasks and environments.

item.title: UL Solutions opens 1st service robot testing lab
item.description: The laboratory, located in South Korea, will test robots for use in homes, retail shops, restaurants, schools and public spaces. The post UL Solutions...

item.title: Gemini Nano Banana improves image editing consistency and control at scale for enterprises – but is not perfect
item.description: The long awaited image editing model nanobanana from Google, now renamed Gemini 2.5 Flash Image, has finally released to the public.

item.title: Anthropic launches Claude for Chrome in limited beta, but prompt injection attacks remain a major concern

item.title: Enterprise leaders say recipe for AI agents is matching them to existing processes — not the other way around
item.description: Global enterprises Block and GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) are exploring AI agent proof of concepts in financial services and drug discovery.

item.title: Infinite Threads

item.title: This website lets you blind-test GPT-5 vs. GPT-4o—and the results may surprise you
item.description: Take this blind test to discover whether you truly prefer OpenAI's GPT-5 or the older GPT-4o—without knowing which model you're using.
